place.name: HASTINGLEIGH
place.gazetteerText: HASTINGLEIGH, a parish in East Ashford district, Kent; 4½ miles ESE of wye r. station, and 8 E by S of A shford. Post town, Elmstead, under Ashford. Acres, 1, 498. Real property, £1, 160. Pop., 198. Houses, 40. The property is divided among a few. About 13 acres are under hops. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £233. * Patron, the Arc1ibishop of Canterbury. The church is very ancient. but good; and consists of two aisles and a chancel, with a tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
